data.description: Department:Technical OperationsOur Company PromiseWe are committed to provide our Employees a stable work environment with equal opportunity for learning and personal growth. Creativity and innovation are encouraged for improving the effectiveness of Southwest Airlines. Above all, Employees will be provided the same concern, respect, and caring attitude within the organization that they are expected to share externally with every Southwest Customer.Job Description:Notice: We ask that you apply with your personal email address rather than your school email (.edu) so we can stay connected about future roles at Southwest. Be sure to attach a resume to your application.   The Technical Data Management Intern will be within the Performance and Technology team in Maintenance Programs (Tech Ops). We are dedicated to providing Southwest Airlines Employees with industry-best operating manuals when and where they are needed. We work with our Customers to create and maintain consistent, thorough, and accurate publications for our Frontline Employees and Customers to create and maintain consistent, thorough, and accurate publications for our Frontline Employees and our Leaders.   Additional Details Join Southwest as a Summer 2026 Intern, with a 12-week internship lasting from May 19 – August 7, 2026.Pay of $20-$22 per hour, corresponding with progress toward degreeStipends may be offered based on eligibility and program criteriaThe culture of Southwest Airlines means we value the camaraderie, collaboration, and innovation that occurs when we come together and interact face-to-face at our vibrant Corporate Campus. Due to the nature of this role, you would be required to work from our Dallas, TX headquarters facility during business hours (2702 Love Field Drive).Dedicate 40 hours each week (maximum of 8 hours per day) to your internship responsibilities and tasks.Receive free, unlimited space available travel privileges for yourself (taxes and fees may apply on international travel).Interns will be provided any required equipment, such as a laptop, for the internship.U.S. citizenship or current authorization to work in the U.S. required and no current or future work authorization sponsorship available.We’re committed to fair hiring practices and to making employment decisions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, age, military or veteran status, disability, genetic information, or other legally protected characteristics. Duties and Responsibilities The duties and responsibilities of the Technical Data Management Intern may include, but are not limited to: Develop and implement strategic process improvements within the Technical Data Management function. Recognize operational inefficiencies in current processes and understanding the importance in improving them. Represent the Technical Data Management team in cross-departmental initiatives and meetings. Applies the usage of standard program, project management, and agile methodologies to address complex projects. Creation and delivering of presentations that are clear and convey key information such as roadmaps, and business cases to support change and drive alignment that can be presented at the executive level. Represent and lead cross-functional projects and initiatives aimed at addressing unique operational challenges. Analyze complex data sets to derive insights that inform long-term strategy and business decisions. Coordinate and facilitate meetings with internal and external stakeholders, including senior leadership. Proactively monitor projects and communicate risks, issues, and scope, ensuring the appropriate level of priority, visibility, and escalation.  Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities Problem solving ability and strong written/verbal communication skills  Foundational understanding of aircraft systems, technical documentation, and maintenance program structures is preferred. Experience in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, PowerPoint, Outlook, and Excel). Ability to work independently and willingness to function as part of a team.  Ability to coordinate multiple tasks and complete assignments with tight deadlines.  Self-starter with a high degree of autonomy and accountability in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Education:  High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required   Progress towards degree, major, or minor Engineering, Aviation, Business Analytics OR similar degree   Progress towards a 4-year undergraduate degree preferred   To be eligible, you must be currently enrolled as a full-time student (as defined by your university) at the time of application and during the internship   At least 3 semesters remaining at the time the internship ends is preferred   Minimum 2.5 cumulative GPA at the time of application    Basic Qualifications   Must be at least 18 years of age   You must have a valid U.S. Social Security Number to complete the full hiring process    Experience:  Preferred: Experience with using tools such as Alteryx, Tableau, Microsoft Office 365 products. Preferred: Foundational understanding of aircraft systems, technical documentation, and maintenance program structures.     Southwest Airlines is an Equal Opportunity Employer.Please print/save this job description because it won't be available after you apply.
requirements: Pay of $20-$22 per hour, corresponding with progress toward degree

The culture of Southwest Airlines means we value the camaraderie, collaboration, and innovation that occurs when we come together and interact face-to-face at our vibrant Corporate Campus. Due to the nature of this role, you would be required to work from our Dallas, TX headquarters facility during business hours (2702 Love Field Drive).
Interns will be provided any required equipment, such as a laptop, for the internship.
U.S. citizenship or current authorization to work in the U.S. required and no current or future work authorization sponsorship available.
Self-starter with a high degree of autonomy and accountability in a fast-paced, dynamic environment
High School Diploma, GED or equivalent education required
Progress towards degree, major, or minor Engineering, Aviation, Business Analytics OR similar degree
Progress towards a 4-year undergraduate degree preferred
Must be at least 18 years of age
You must have a valid U.S. Social Security Number to complete the full hiring process
responsibilities: Dedicate 40 hours each week (maximum of 8 hours per day) to your internship responsibilities and tasks.
The duties and responsibilities of the Technical Data Management Intern may include, but are not limited to:
Develop and implement strategic process improvements within the Technical Data Management function.
Ability to work independently and willingness to function as part of a team.
